[[Center(begin)]]
== '''Hirlam System Documentation''' ==
= HIRLAM-7.4 Parameter List, GRIB Definition, Operational Data Archive at ECMWF =
[[Center(end)]]

=== HIRLAM forecast model output and reference data archive ===
The forecast model writes its primary output to history file (fcyyyymmdd_hh+lll), which is designed to be a complete snapshot of the model state described by HIRLAM model for a particular time point (on the hour). In addition, through specification of namelist NAMPPP, more model output including post-processing/diagnostic fields can be written out during the forecast model integration, such as those model diagnostics (with suffix ''md'' such as fcyyyymmdd_hh+lllmd),  pressure and single level parameters for field verification and observation verification (with suffix ''ve'' such as fcyyyymmdd_hh+lllve). In the tables below, abbreviations used for the different file type are: fc=''history file'', fcmd=''diagnostics file'' and fcve=''verification file''. 

At the HIRLAM reference computer platform ECMWF, up till March 1, 2004, main results of a HIRLAM forecast cycle are archived into a tar file, ARyyyymmdd_hh.tar under ECFS. The files for verification (fc*ve) and the ascii file with verification results (ve*) , are collected into a second tar file, VEyyyymmdd_hh.tar. The lateral boundary files are stored into a third tar file, MFyyyymmdd_hh.tar, which is also archived. These files as well as other older archives can be found in ec:/rui/hirlam/RCRa.

For the period after March 1 2004, the reference HIRLAM forecast as conducted operationally at FMI, RCRa, the data archives are maintained in untarred form in the ECMWF's ECFS at address 

       ec:/rui/hirlam/RCRa/yyyy/mm/dd/hh    (March 1, 2004 - March 31, 2006) 
       ec:/hirlam/RCRa/yyyy/mm/dd/hh        (April 1, 2006 -  ) 

In the following tables, differences with the earlier HIRLAM version (7.3) have been indicated as follows:

 * '''''[[Color(red, Changed variables in red-bold-italic.)]]''''' GRIB code, unit or content has been changed.

 * [[Color(red, New variables in red.)]] New variable included in the default output.

 * ~~Removed variables in strike-through.~~ GRIB code removed from this version.

 * [[Color(green, Optional variables in the present version in green.)]] Available through namelist specification, not included in the default output.

=== Three-dimensional tendencies and fluxes due to physical parametrizations ===

In addition to the variables listed above, it is possible to request output of the components of dT/dt, dq/dt, dcw/dt, du/dt, dv/dt and dk/dt (k=resolved kinetic energy diagnosed from u and v) due to physical parametrizations, i.e. radiation, turbulence and condensation, accumulated from the analysis time to the forecast valid time. Tendencies of cloud ice and TKE are not available. Accumulated net longwave and net shortwave radiation fluxes are available at model levels.

=== Surface subtypes ===

There are seven subtypes of surface variables in Hirlam 7.4:
|| subtype  || subtype name ||
|| 1  || sea or inland water ||
|| 2  || sea or inland ice ||
|| 3  || bare land
|| 4  || low vegetation
|| 5  || forest
|| 6  || snow over open land, internal variable
|| 7  || snow over forest, internal variable
